synonyms: probability value, significance value, statistical measure
daily: A low p-value is like having strong evidence that your observation wasn't just due to chance.
pharmaceutical: The clinical trial showed a p-value of 0.003, confirming the drug's statistically significant efficacy.
dataScience: Features with p-values below 0.05 were retained for the final predictive model.

synonyms: uncertainty interval, margin of error, estimation range
daily: Like saying 'I'm 95% confident the delivery will arrive between 2-4 PM' instead of giving an exact time.
pharmaceutical: The 95% confidence interval for treatment efficacy ranged from 68% to 82%.
dataScience: Bootstrap sampling was used to calculate confidence intervals for model performance metrics.

synonyms: statistical testing, significance testing, inferential analysis
daily: Like testing whether a new study method really improves grades or if the improvement was just luck.
pharmaceutical: Hypothesis testing confirmed that the new formulation significantly reduces side effects compared to placebo.
dataScience: A/B testing uses hypothesis testing to determine which website version performs better.

daily: High variance in daily temperatures means some days are much hotter or cooler than the average.
pharmaceutical: Low variance in drug absorption rates indicates consistent bioavailability across patients.
dataScience: Principal component analysis reduces dimensionality while preserving maximum variance in the data.

synonyms: probability distribution, data pattern, frequency distribution
daily: The distribution of heights in a population shows most people are average height with fewer very tall or short individuals.
pharmaceutical: The normal distribution of biomarker levels helps establish reference ranges for healthy patients.
dataScience: Understanding the underlying distribution is crucial for selecting appropriate statistical tests.

daily: If everyone in your friend group is around 5'8" tall and one person is 6'5", they're an outlier.
pharmaceutical: Outliers in clinical data may represent rare adverse events or exceptional treatment responses.
dataScience: Robust statistical methods were used to handle outliers without removing potentially valuable information.

daily: High variance in daily temperatures means some days are much hotter or cooler than the average.
pharmaceutical: Low variance in drug absorption rates indicates consistent bioavailability across patients.
dataScience: Principal component analysis reduces dimensionality while preserving maximum variance in the data.

synonyms: probability distribution, data pattern, frequency distribution
daily: The distribution of heights in a population shows most people are average height with fewer very tall or short individuals.
pharmaceutical: The normal distribution of biomarker levels helps establish reference ranges for healthy patients.
dataScience: Understanding the underlying distribution is crucial for selecting appropriate statistical tests.

daily: If everyone in your friend group is around 5'8" tall and one person is 6'5", they're an outlier.
pharmaceutical: Outliers in clinical data may represent rare adverse events or exceptional treatment responses.
dataScience: Robust statistical methods were used to handle outliers without removing potentially valuable information.

daily: Like creating a summary of a long book that captures all the key points in fewer pages.
pharmaceutical: Dimensionality reduction simplified genomic data from 20,000 genes to 50 key biomarkers.
dataScience: PCA reduced the 1000-dimensional feature space to 20 components explaining 95% of variance.
